fields.headline: Bournemouth v Liverpool: match preview
fields.bodyText: It is still early doors but Liverpool look head and shoulders above the rest in the Premier League. They are unbeaten in 32 games – a club record – and can win with explosive attacking power or with defensive grit and determination. Bournemouth’s chances of even a point look grim considering their best player this season – Harry Wilson – is unavailable to face his parent club. Liverpool have won their last four meetings by an aggregate score of 14-0. Graham Searles Saturday 3pm Venue Vitality Stadium Last season Bournemouth 0 Liverpool 4 Referee Chris Kavanagh This season G11 Y39 R0 3.54 cards/game Odds H 13-2 A 1-2 D 4-1 BOURNEMOUTH Subs from Boruc, Travers, Gosling, Ibe, Stacey, Simpson, Kelly, Dobre, L Cook Doubtful None Injured Surman (knee), King (hamstring, both 14 Dec), Stanislas (knee, Jan), Brooks (ankle), S Cook (wrist), Daniels (knee), Smith (ankle, all unknown) Suspended None Unavailable H Wilson (loan terms) Discipline Y31 R1 Form DWLLLL Leading scorer H Wilson 6 LIVERPOOL Subs from Adrian, Lonergan, Kelleher, Salah, Milner, Keïta, Shaqiri, Gomez, Lallana, Brewster, Jones Doubtful None Injured Matip (knee, 14 Dec), Clyne (knee, Jan), Fabinho (ankle, Jan) Suspended None Discipline Y15 R1 Form WWWWWW Leading scorer Mané 9
